document_data.name: Then My Mourning Heart Can Sleep
document_data.author: [[Shymon and Scarbunkel]]
document_data.mainbody: '''''Then My Mourning Heart Can Sleep''''' was a mournful ballad performed by a minstrel duo named [[Shymon and Scarbunkel]] in many taverns and inns across [[northwest Faer√ªn]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Contents:
{{quote|''Oh, my love, the sun is fading
Night grows cold, long shadows creep
But I hear you in the darkness
Your sweet song guides me into sleep
When I wake anew
Then my dream of you
It fades until
It fades until...
You are here
Here...
I'll waste no time
I'll waste no time 'til...
'Til you are mine
Then my mourning heart can sleep...
...my mourning heart can sleep...''|Shymon and Scarbunkel}} The song was performed in gentle harmony, with the second voice occasionally slipping into echoing a line and the two voices switching leads.
document_data.History: Some time around and after the {{YearlinkName|1372}}, Shymon and Scarbunkel, a pair of handsome young minstrels could be heard performing their songs, including ''Then My Mourning Heart Can Sleep'' across the [[Sword Coast North]], including the [[Wandering Woodsman's Tavern]] in [[Conyberry]], the [[Danley and Sons Inn]] in [[Phandalin]], the [[Dusty Gnome Tavern]] in [[Leilon]], the [[New Leaf Tavern]] in the hamlet of [[New Leaf]], the [[Phoenix Tail Inn]] in the [[Crossroad Keep]], the [[Seaspray Inn]] in [[Highcliff]], and the [[The Hammer and Shield Inn]] in [[Thundertree]].
